TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed DragDropEffects extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies the possible effects of a drag-and-drop operation.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This enumeration is used by the following classes: <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DragEventArgs>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.GiveFeedbackEventArgs>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control>.
You can use <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DragDropEffects> to display different mouse pointers for drag-and-drop operations. For example, you can display a plus symbol for a Copy drag-and-drop operation, an arrow symbol for a Move drag-and-drop operation, or a red circle with a line through it symbol for a None drag-and-drop operation.
If you want to drop data at a position in the target that is not currently visible, you could scroll the target while dragging. If a target does not support scrolling, you must make sure that the drop position is visible in the target before you begin the drag-and-drop operation. The following are some scenarios when you might want to scroll a target:
- You are dragging text into a document, and you want to drop the text at a position not visible in the document window.
- You are dragging a file into a file tree, and you want to drop the file on a node not visible in the file tree.
## Examples This code example demonstrates using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DragDropEffects.Copy> enumeration when the user moves the mouse over the drop target during a drag-and-drop operation. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.DoDragDrop%2A> method of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> class. See the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.DoDragDrop%2A> method for the complete code example.
[!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.Control.DoDragDrop#4](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.Control.DoDragDrop/CPP/form1.cpp#4)] [!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.Control.DoDragDrop#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.Control.DoDragDrop/CS/form1.cs#4)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.Control.DoDragDrop#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.Control.DoDragDrop/VB/form1.vb#4)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.DragDropEffects All = int32(-2147483645)

Docs.summary: The combination of the , , and effects.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.DragDropEffects Copy = int32(1)

Docs.summary: The data from the drag source is copied to the drop target.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.DragDropEffects Link = int32(4)

Docs.summary: The data from the drag source is linked to the drop target.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.DragDropEffects Move = int32(2)

Docs.summary: The data from the drag source is moved to the drop target.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.DragDropEffects None = int32(0)

Docs.summary: The drop target does not accept the data.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.DragDropEffects Scroll = int32(-2147483648)

Docs.summary: The target can be scrolled while dragging to locate a drop position that is not currently visible in the target.
